benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/credits/{creditId} - Retrieve a credit by id

covered: Valid Request: Scenarios TC01 and TC02 cover successful retrieval for CREDIT_ADJ and CBA_ADJ types with correct status (200) and payload shape.
Empty Response / No Data: TC03 and TC18 validate 404 when no matching data or system is empty.
Query Parameters: TC08 tests ignoring an unexpected query parameter and returning a valid response.
Authorization: TC06 and TC07 cover missing/invalid/expired tokens resulting in 401.
Invalid Input: TC05, TC12, TC16, TC17 test invalid formats, security-injection, truncated/whitespace-padded IDs resulting in 400.
Not Found for wrong type: TC11 ensures non-target types return 404.
Error handling on DB/dependency: TC10 covers 503 when DB down, TC03/TC11/TC05 cover not found/invalid data scenarios, TC04 similar not found case.
Performance/Degradation: TC09 (response time under threshold), TC19 (concurrent requests under threshold).
Security: TC12 (SQL injection), TC13 (XSS) addressed, ensuring system isn’t compromised.
Backward compatibility: TC20 addresses compatibility with older API version.
gaps: Pagination: No tests cover pagination behavior when listing or handling large result sets for credits (if API returns a collection; not applicable to single GET, but still a Guideline gap).
Authorization: No explicit test for 403 Forbidden (authenticated but not allowed) scenario.
Caching Behavior: No tests validating caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or client-side revalidation.
Rate Limiting: Limited to performance hints but no explicit throttling/rate-limit enforcement tests beyond response time (TC09/TC19).
Server Error Variants: Only 503 for DB down; no explicit 500 Internal Server Error or other recovery paths.
Boundary/Edge Coverage: Some boundary tests exist (TC14, TC16, TC17, TC18), but additional edge cases around extremely long UUIDs or mixed-case UUIDs could be considered.
recommendations: Add an explicit 403 Forbidden test to cover authenticated-but-not-authorized scenarios.
Add tests for caching headers (ETag/Cache-Control) and conditional requests to verify caching behavior.
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests (TC beyond a single/dependent burst) to assess handling under flood conditions.
Introduce additional 500 Internal Server Error scenarios to ensure robust server-side fault handling beyond 503 (e.g., DB timeouts, service unavailable during maintenance).
Clarify pagination needs and add a test if the API can return a list (or for future endpoints) to cover pagination behavior when applicable.
Consider additional edge cases for creditId formatting variations (case sensitivity, UUID with separators, etc.) to strengthen invalid-input coverage.
